titles: The slighted maid: or, The pining lover: with sighs and moans she doth intreat her dear, whilst he seems to be deaf and will not hear: at length his frozen heart begins to melt, being moved with the passion she had felt. To the tune of, I prithee love turn me, &c. Licens'd and enter'd according to order.
publisher: Printed for  W.O. for A.M, sold by C. Bates, at the Sun and Bible in Pye-corner.,
notes: Date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
